title: Gordon Ramsay's in-laws to appear in court charged with hacking the celebrity chef's emails
text:
Gordon and Tania Ramsay arrive at the High Court for an earlier hearing (Photo: TIM ANDERSON) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Gordon Ramsay’s estranged in-laws will appear in court charged with hacking into the celebrity chef ’s emails. 
After a long-running feud that has ripped the family apart, father-in-law Chris Hutcheson, estranged from the foul-mouthed TV favourite, and his son and daughter, will face criminal charges, it has been announced. 
Mr Hutcheson, 68, ran Ramsay’s business empire for 12 years alongside the firebrand chef as a “committee of two” before a spectacular fall-out in October 2010. 
After dad-of-four Ramsay, 50, fired Mr Hutcheson, the pair publicly traded insults before Ramsay declared war on his wife Tana’s family in a High Court writ filed the following August. 
Among a raft of sensation claims was an allegation that Mr Hutcheson had hacked into Ramsay’s personal and company files. Chris Hutcheson with his son Adam (Photo: SWNS) Chris Hutcheson arrives at the High Court for an earlier hearing (Photo: SWNS) 
A legal settlement two years later cost Ramsay £2million to cut all professional ties with Mr Hutcheson. 
It is thought Tana Ramsay, married to the chef for 21 years, has not spoken to her family since 
Scotland Yard said Mr Hutcheson, of Druillat, France; his sons, Chris, 37, of Welwyn Garden City, Herts; and Adam, 46; and daughter Orlando Butland, 45, of Wandworth, south London, have all been told to report to court on March 14 for a first hearing. Chris Hutcheson at the High Court for an earlier hearing (Photo: SWNS) Chris Hutcheson, his son Adam and daughter Orlanda Butland (Photo: SWNS) Chris Hutcheson (L) and wife Greta (Photo: Getty) 
Adam Hutcheson, of Sevenoaks, Kent, was managing director of Ramsay’s holdings before being sacked alongside his father. 
A Met Police spokesman said: “The charges follow allegations that between October 23, 2010, and March 3, 2011, they conspired together to cause a computer to access programs and data held in any computer without authority.” Like us on Facebook
